titles.title: Hakkenden: Touhou Hakken Ibun (2013)
Hakkenden - Eight Dogs of the East S2
Hakkenden: Eight Dogs of the East 2
八犬伝 -東方八犬異聞- (2013)
Hakkenden: Eight Dogs of the East (2013)
八犬传-东方八犬异闻- 第二季

anime.description: They would have lost their lives if they did not make the choice back then. The legendary eight beads and their owners... One is for someone important, and one is for his life as a human. The story of a destiny to encounter and fights lead by the beads, have just begun. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: transforming guardian
tag.description: Guardian-like characters in this anime, e.g. Guardian Angels, will actually transform into another usually "powered up" version of themselves.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: folklore
tag.description: Folklore, or simply Lore, are the traditions of a culture, subculture, or group, in the form of legends, music, proverbs, jokes, popular beliefs, fairy tales, stories, tall tales and customs. In usage, there is a continuum between folklore and mythology. Folklore is generally divided into four areas of study: physical artifacts, transmissible entities and stories, culture and technologies, and behaviors and rituals. [From Wikipedia]

tag.name: Japanese mythology
tag.description: Japanese mythology is a system of beliefs that embraces Shinto and Buddhist traditions as well as agriculture-based folk religion. The Shinto pantheon alone consists of an uncountable number of kami (Japanese for "gods" or "spirits"). (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: animal transforms into weapon
tag.description: A being that appears to be a normal animal, is actually something much more, for it can transform into a weapon.

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

tag.name: Hakkenden
tag.description: Nansou Satomi Hakkenden (The Tale of Eight Dogs) is a Japanese epic novel in 106 volumes written by Kyokutei Bakin over nearly 30 years in the first half of the 19th century.

character.name: Inuzuka Shino
character.description: Holder of the Devotion bead, Shino is one of three teenagers who survived the destruction of Ootsuka Village five years prior. He found himself near dying as his village burned, but chose life over death and now harbors the living spirit sword http://anidb.net/ch49445 [Murasame] in his arm. With Murasame comes the curse of not aging, which explains his looks. He has a birthmark in the shape of a peony flower on his right arm. He feels a special attachment to his childhood friends http://anidb.net/ch49443 [Sousuke] and http://anidb.net/ch49444 [Hamaji], the other two survivors of Ootsuka Village.

character.name: Inukawa Sousuke
character.description: Sousuke is one of the three children who survived the destruction of Ootsuka village 5 years prior. He did not have relatives and thus was raised with http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino] and http://anidb.net/ch49444 [Hamaji], the other two survivors, as if they were siblings. He has a peony-shaped birthmark on the back of his neck. Ever since the accident he has an ability to transform into the dog Yoshiro, who makes up half of himself. His real other half is manifested in Ao, his shadow, causing Sousuke`s memories and body parts to be split between the two. This causes Sousuke to not remember everything from his past, as well as slowly losing the ability to feel pain, and the sight in his left eye. He is the holder of the Duty bead.

character.name: Hamaji
character.description: Hamaji is like a sister to http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino] and http://anidb.net/ch49443 [Sousuke], having been raised with them since childhood. Along with them, she survived the destruction of Otsuka Village. She is something of a health nut, and obsessed with making sure everyone around her maintains a proper diet, but her cooking skills leave a lot to be desired. Unlike her pretty appearance, she often manipulates Shino and Sousuke, but in heart, she cares about them. Source: ANN

character.name: Murasame
character.description: Murasame is a living spirit sword rumored to hold sway over all things without shape or form, but it is said that whomever the sword possesses will meet a violent and tragic end. The blade ordinarily takes the form of a crow and speaks in human language, concealing itself on http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino]`s right arm when resting. Murasame sometimes picks and eats food that somebody dropped, and Shino scolds Murasame for the behavior. Source: ANN

character.name: Inukai Genpachi
character.description: Genpachi is a captain of the imperial military police. One day he went on an assignment, accompanied by his soon-to-be brother-in-law http://anidb.net/ch50984 [Kobungo] into the north three years priors just to returned as a demon, who is hungry for spirits. He was supposed to marry Kobungo`s sister Nui, but upon their arrival, they had to find she has committed suicide. It was said that she carried the child of another man, whom she couldn`t identify, and due to having been received the news of her fiancées soon return, she couldn`t take it anymore. Genpachi is often seen sparkling when looking at people who fit his type. He prays on Shino and hopes he will grow up soon. He is the holder of the Faith bead.

character.name: Inuta Kobungo
character.description: Kobungo`s family runs the Konaya bed-and-breakfast inn, and Kobungo himself is excellent at caring for people`s needs. Three years prior, he volunteered as a foot soldier and accompanied the soon to be husband of his sister, http://anidb.net/ch50983 [Genpachi], in an army deployment sent to contain an incident taking place in a remote northern village. There the whole squad has been killed by man-eating demons. Since then he is able to change into a demon himself. He is the holder of the Brotherhood bead.

character.name: Inuyama Dousetsu
character.description: After dying in snow, Yuki Hime brought him back and is from now always by his side - both protecting him from evil and women. He comes from a family of physicians and says the colour of his hair is this weird because of his lineage and the early onset immunity to certain medicines/drugs. From that time he remembers a younger sister, Mutsuki, whom he is searching for since his death, carrying a hairpin with him that she once slipped into his pocket before being separated. He is the holder of the Loyalty bead.

character.name: Inusaka Keno
character.description: Travelling with the music group, he is looking to take revenge on the one who `took everything from him` two years prior. This man also happened to carve his heart out, yet Keno refused to die. Kokonoe, the demon princess, was very fond of that behaviour, so she brought him back and since then is travelling with him. Due to his extreme beautiful looks he gets mistaken for a woman more than just once. He`s the holder of the Wisdom bead.

character.name: Satomi Riou
character.description: Member of the Four Houses, and, according to Shino, the one who saved the three from Ootsuka Village five years prior.

character.name: Osaki Kaname
character.description: One of the members of the Four Houses. His beasts consist of five foxes who act as servants to the inhabitants of the mansion the members live in. Like so many others before him, he was cast out of his family for being a "disgrace" after having been chosen by the fox spirits.

character.name: Mizuki Ayane
character.description: Ayane was born into the Mizuki family without any colouring. As an albino she has been taken care of by Chikage, a snake deity and protector of the Mizuki`s land - because she`s just the same as him. Ayane is being overly protected by Chikage, who actually only tries to fulfil her desires. She is the last living member of the Mizuki family.

character.name: Megu
character.description: One-eyed monster which has the appearance of a black sphere.

character.name: Yatsufusa
character.description: Yatsufusa is a giant dog that is part of the Four Houses. It is said that he normally choses a female, yet chose Satomi Riou in this life. This might be explained by Rious most beautiful looks.

character.name: Kokonoe
character.description: Princess Yasha.

character.name: Yukihime
character.description: A Snow Princess and a friend of Shino. Once lost in the snowy forest, she helped Shino find his way home. She is known to sing beautiful songs that almost sound like lullabies. For saving Inuyama Dousetsu`s life, she had to sacrifice her voice.

character.name: Chikage
character.description: Chikage is the beast of Ayane. She sometimes appears in the shape of a human. Unlike the other beasts, Chikage has grown too large to leave the mansion, also limiting Ayane`s capability of traveling. As Chikage is very protective of Ayane due to her health, she needs some time to be persuaded by Shino to have the foxes accompany her outside.

character.name: Inuta Sayoko
character.description: Mother of Inuta Kobungo, and innkeeper.

character.name: Ao
character.description: A mysterious figure who looks just like Inukawa Sousuke. It is explained that this is due to the fact that at the incident five years prior Sousuke`s soul was split into two halfes. He can pretty much be compared to an "evil twin".

character.name: Raiki
character.description: Thunder demon.

character.name: Fuuki
character.description: Wind demon.

character.name: Fenegan
character.description: An elite member of the church.

character.name: Lilith
character.description: The guardian spirit of the church`s building. Strong, beautiful, and feared.

character.name: Saiki Akane
character.description: The village doctor.

character.name: Sakuraba Jouji
character.description: Now a medical examiner, Sakuraba Jouji (or George) is an old aquaintance of Inuta Kobungo and Inukai Genpachi from military times.

character.name: Tamazusa
character.description: A mysterious nun working together with Sousuke`s shadow Ao. She is trying to prevent Satomi from collecting all 8 beads. Her existence is explained in a legend. She came to the country from a foreign land together with her two young sons. The government wasn`t too happy about that and forced her to give up one of them to the officials. She eventually decided to give up her youngest, whom was also very sickly at this time, so he had a chance of survival. They took him away and killed him. When the older son learned of that, he commited suicide. She was left devestated. Later on it is found out that she is the woman everybody is looking for.

character.name: Inumura Daikaku
character.description: Older brother of Inumura Hinaginu, and heir to their family business of doll making. He is already dead but came back to life thanks to his guardian cat Noro. He is sprouting an evil eye on his forehead, that has been bestowed onto him by said cat spirit. With that he can see spirits and even make them disappear. He is the holder of the Etiquette bead.

character.name: Chudai
character.description: An exorcist that is riding on the same train. He is looking for evil spirits to get rid of them.

character.name: Rou Sister
character.description: This character is actually present as two elderly sisters (nuns). They look the same, and they sound the same.

character.name: Inue Shinobu
character.description: Class officer of year 6 class 3. When he was six years old, he disappeared. About 10 years later, his grandmother Tae asked Chudai to find him. He did, yet Shinobu remained with the looks of a six year old. Unlike Shino, he continued aging. He carries the Benevolence bead.

character.name: Hinozuka Nachi
character.description: One of the four members of the "Four Sacred Beast Houses", he is capable of summoning a large black panther called Kaede. He tends to have a laid back personality, but can be serious when he wants to. He also seems to be privy to Rio`s secrets and tends to act in the shadows (not to mention takes his time on missions). His panther doesn`t like the main House too much, saying it`s much too crowded with all the other Beasts there.

character.name: Kagetsu
character.description: The tengu that saved Shinobu`s life, trying to replace a father figure afterwards. He has bequeatherd half of himself unto Shinobu, thus making him half-tengu.

character.name: Hazuki
character.description: A tengu that helped raise Shinobu on the other side. After Shinobu has been taken back to his real family, Hazuki tried to find him to bring him back.

character.name: Kinko
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 金 on the back.

character.name: Gingitsune
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 銀 on the back.

character.name: Kuroko
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 黒 on the back.

character.name: Tenko
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 天 on the back.

character.name: Byakko
character.description: One of the foxservants of Osaki Kaname. His kimono has the kanji 白 on the back.

character.name: Kaede
character.description: A two-tailed panther spirit belonging to Hinozuka Nachi. He originally chose Nachi`s older brother Yuri, who sadly didn`t have the sight to see the Sacred Beasts, so he didn`t think it was real. When he had to leave the Hinozuka mansion and went into the manor, he was suddenly able to see Kaede, yet couldn`t bare it - he denied the existence of Kaede. As Nachi was given the sight, Kaede chose him instead of Yuri later. Since then, Yuri has already passed away.

character.name: Noro
character.description: Appearing as a human boy in a kimono playing with a ball on the Inumura family estate, Noro has become the guardian spirit of his previous owner/friend Daikaku.

character.name: Kaho
character.description: Born blind, Kaho is a very kind child that visits the local school. He has developed a liking to foreign fairytales. She has been found in front of a brothel in the red-light-district with her name scribbled on some paper.

character.name: Atsushi
character.description: Atsushi is a rowdy pupil at the school.

character.name: Yana
character.description: The local deity, called Yana (written with the kanji for Life twice), has two lives. One of them is sealed in the local shrine as a living god. In fact, it`s sealed in the body of the shrine maiden, who was born with. The second Yana was using a buck as a vessel. The buck has been slain by Ao, who is now a vessel to him. The seal of Yana on his left upper arm is proof of that. Later Murasame eats the spirit, making Shino bear the seal. Yana takes form as a huge two-headed dragon when whole. It`s original duty was to grant the wish of its vessel. Instead over the years the vessel has become the fullfiller of wishes for the villagers. After becoming whole again and fullfilling its original duty, Yana was bound to vanish, instead it was able to live on in Ao, requested by Shino.

character.name: Takanobu
character.description: The male guardian who has been with Yana Hime since she was born. The guardians look over the princess as well as managing the shrine.

character.name: Saki
character.description: The female guardian who has been with Yana Hime since she was born. The guardians look over the princess as well as managing the shrine.

character.name: Narumura Akihiko
character.description: A boy from year 6 class 3. He went to the mountain and returned pretty much mute, and with white coloured hair. Since his return he also doesn`t eat, yet drinks only water.

character.name: Inumura Norikiyo
character.description: A high praised dollmaker and foster father of Inumura Daikaku, whom he took care of since finding him roaming around in the area.

character.name: Daikaku no Jippu
character.description: Daikaku`s biological father. He left his son in the care of famous dollmaker Inumura Norikiyo. After a while he returned and wanted money, because his offspring was now also able to sell dolls. A real scumbag.

character.name: Noro
character.description: Officially not given a name, Noro was a cat Daikaku found in the crawlspace of the estate. They became very close to one another very fast. Daikaku said, upon being asked by Shino how he would call the cat over without a name, that he didn`t have to, it was always right by his side. Noro was the only animal that ever approached Daikaku.

character.name: Shounen
character.description: A young boy (shounen), supposedly Shino, who is shown in a flashback walking with his mother and his dog, who should become the other half of Inukawa Sousuke, Yoshiro.

character.name: Gouki
character.description: Gouki is one of the children from Shino`s class.

character.name: Daikokudou Shujin
character.description: A man working at and owning the Daikoku store. Their business is Nikuman. He`s a good friend of Shino, who helps him write down his recipes, as he is illiterate himself. He`s been dead all along.

character.name: Daikokudou Tsuma
character.description: She`s working in the Nikuman shop together with her daughter.

character.name: Daikokudou Musume
character.description: Daughter of the owners of the Nikuman shop, where she also works.

character.name: Yamamoto
character.description: Part of the military/police. He answers to Inukai Genpachi.

character.name: Yana-hime
character.description: Princess Yana is the shrine maiden of the shrine which recently had its local deity killed by the man that is only half a soul, Ao. She has two guardians, one female, Saki, and one male, Takanobu. Both have chosen themselves to be guardian, and have been reimbursed one was or another. Since Yana Hime knows them for so long, she sees them as her siblings and not just her guardians. She carries the seal of Yana, the local deity, on her body since birth. Because of that she is not able to leave the shrine. The villagers call her the living god, as well as Yana`s bride. Yana Hime never knew her parents, nor the day she was born. When she dies, there will be another child born with the seal, and become a living vessel.

character.name: Bijo
character.description: A beautiful woman (bijo) that just wants to show Inuyama Dousetsu the way to the inn. After showing some kind of affection she falls victim to Yuki Hime`s jealousy.

character.name: Yana
character.description: Freed from the seal of Yana, Yana Hime gets a new hair cut, leaves the shrine behind and changes her name to just Yana. She now attends the same school as Hamaji and can finally live a happy life.

character.name: Asen
character.description: A weird figure approaching Inuta Kobungo and Inusaka Keno from the shadows, offering help looking for a girl. He`s calling himself a kindred spirit, but he of course is a demon. A murderous one.

character.name: Tae
character.description: An elderly woman who seems to have made aquantances with Inukawa Sousuke.

character.name: Akihiko no Chichi
character.description: Akihiko`s worried father.

character.name: Akihiko no Haha
character.description: Akihiko`s mother. She became sick and coughed a lot. After having been admitted to the hospital, she never returned home. She`s not very much aware of her son`s condition, as her husband never brought him for a visit.

character.name: Kaburagi Kayako
character.description: Homeroom teacher at the school for year 6 class 3.

character.name: Natsume
character.description: A familar of the tengu.

character.name: Shinobu no Haha
character.description: Shinobu`s mother. She is never shown completely. Always saying she doesn`t know who Shinobu`s father is, kept him locked away out of sight in shame. She didn`t want the villagers to see. One day thile she was still pregnant, she wrote a letter to her mother, Tae, stating, that she is carrying a tengu`s child. In disbelief, Tae abandoned both. Shinobu`s mother wasn`t happy with her life at all, and one day, when dragging Shinobu up a mountain, she slipped and both fell to their death.

character.name: Yon Shishi Jinka
character.description: There are four Houses, the animals of those houses being the fox, the wolf, the snake, and the cat (or panther in this case), called the Four Sacred Beast Houses. The wielders of the Sacred Beasts are very powerful and tend to be feared, which is why the Church chose to take them in; so that they could control them. The wielders also tend to be ostracized by their families, even being called disgraces for some reason, so they are usually alone except for each other. The members are chosen by the beasts before their birth, and protect them from then on. They all live together in a huge mansion.

character.name: Hakkenshi
character.description: It is said that when the 8 holders of the beads granted to them by Princes Fuse in their prior life come together again, she will be revived and fullfil their wishes. All members carry the same birthmark, a peony, and were born with one of the beads.

character.name: Igyou no You
character.description: A spirit that says she knows where to find Ao, when Shino is looking for him. Instead she actually only wants to eat Shino. She first appears as a human female, but then changes form into an armless skeleton snake.

character.name: Kon
character.description: Animal compainion of Ao.

episode.title: 無明
Ignorance
Mumyou
episode.summary: When Shino learns Ao’s current whereabouts, he runs off to find him. While in the countryside, he meets Princess Yana, who harbors the other half of a regional deity Ao killed! Can he protect Princess Yana from Ao and get Sosuke’s gem back? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逆流
Reverse Flow
Gyakuryuu
episode.summary: Sometimes Shino touches the lives of others without it. From reading a book to an orphan girl and giving meaning to her name, to helping a steamed bun chef come up with some new recipes, Shino warms the hearts of everyone he encounters. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 廻縁
Molding
Mawaribuchi
episode.summary: Shino breaks the cat goblin’s barrier around Daikaku’s house, allowing a grotesque monster to return. Who could Daikaku’s old cat be trying to protect him from? With the barrier released, Daikaku’s sealed memories are returning... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人形
Doll
Ningyou
episode.summary: hino, Sosuke and Genpachi set out to a rural mountain to retrieve a set of dolls for Finnegan. Shino treats the errand like a mini vacation until he learns that the doll maker, Norikiyo, has gone missing! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 神隠
Spirited Away
Kamikakushi
episode.summary: Shino and Sosuke visit a village to investigate a young boy was recently found after getting spirited away. Shino is intrigued with how the boy looks the exact same as when he vanished a year ago. Could this be the owner of the eighth gem? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逢着
Chance Encounters
Houchaku
episode.summary: Dosetsu comes to the Imperial Capital in search for his long lost sister, Mutsuki. Kobungo agrees to help look for her, but only manages to make matters worse when he accidentally enlists the aid of a goblin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 追想
Reminiscence
Tsuisou
episode.summary: Kaede decides to run away from home and it’s up to Shino to find him! After Shino manages to find Kaede, the cat is impressed by the young man’s indomitable smile. It reminds him of another man, who also used to smile a lot... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 讃有
In Homage
Sanyuu
episode.summary: Shino protects Ao from his own shadow and helps Princess Yana realize who she should really be granting wishes for. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 追駆
Pursuit
Oikake
episode.summary: Shino is desperate to get Sosuke’s gem back, but neither Ao nor Tamazusa is going to make this easy. All of his friends are willing to help, but is it really wise to gather all eight of the Dog Warriors in one place...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 岐路
Crossroads
Kiro
episode.summary: Shino has many epiphanies this time around. First Sosuje is falling apart and second Finnegan knows more than Shino wants to believe. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 双月
Twin Moons
Sougetsu
episode.summary: Shinobu is fatally injured when trying to protect Hazuki from Ao! Now it is Hazuki’s turn to save Shinobu at the cost of half of his own life. With Ao still after them, does Hazuki have the strength left to protect Shinobu and his gem? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天巡
Encompassing Heavens
Amameguri
episode.summary: Ao breaks the anti-Tengu barriers that have been keeping Shinobu hidden from the Tengu that had spirited him away. Hazuki is quick to retrieve his “son” once he finds him. While on the other side, Shinobu’s sealed memories resurface... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命
Fate
Unmei
episode.summary: In the final battle against Princess Tamazusa, Murasame overtakes Shino’s body and goes on a rampage! Will the combined forces of all of Shino’s friends be enough to suppress the raging beast and save Shino? Source: crunchyroll
